column4: Hi. I'm currently running 3 tightvnc servers on my ubuntu box... How can I kill 2 of the processes? I just need 1 of em up.. :)
vncserver -kill :2 kills the instance on display :"
vncserver -kill :2 kills the instance on display :2
Hmm ok thanks!
Has anyone tried running a wmware windows inside of ubutu 11+ ?
Or perhaps a vmware ubuntu 11+ runs better on win? :P
Ermm - It doesnt matter what you are running inside a vm.
So they both work equally 'great' ?
Assuming i have the horsepower
I'd recommend virtualbox instead of vmware, unless using an ESX host.
It works like vmware more or less?
Yes.
Only x86?
32bit and 64bit.
Or get it as Oracle VM Server on SPARC.
Hmm okay :) well I'm gonna run the VB in windows (but that didnt matter right? and then run ubuntu inside) shouldnt be an issue right? just get vb + the most recent stable ubuntu iso?
Yeah figured and when i actually play games i can play them in natural... enviroments, instead of vming.. Since my ubunt usuage isnt very performance heavy
Thanks for the pointers
Can i netinstall with VB? or iso required i assume?
You should use the official vbox version from www.virtualbox.org - and yes, you need an ISO of the OS you want to install as a guest.
There's a ubuntu version suited for VB?
